wikipedia_page.main: Kathleen Knox (1847 – 1930) was an Irish author and poet who used the pen name Edward Kane in later life.

response: Born in 1808 at Dungannon Park, County Tyrone, the country seat of his grandfather, Thomas Knox, 1st Viscount Northland (d. 1818), Knox was the second son of the Hon. Charles Knox (d. 1825), Archdeacon of Armagh, and his wife, Hannah, the daughter of Robert Bent .Gordon, Alexander, "Knox, Robert Bent (1808–1893)", rev. David Huddleston, in Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (Oxford University Press, 2004).  (subscription required for online access).  Retrieved on 19 December 2008. His uncles were the bishops William Knox and Edmund Knox, his niece was the writer Kathleen Knox.
*Kathleen Knox (1847–1930), Irish author and poet who used the pen name Edward Kane in later life
